entry.title: Ajax
entry.content:
Spring 下的 Ajax

code

//User

public class User {
    private String name;
    private String sex;
    //省略get set toString 方法
}

要添加spring依赖

//Controller类
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/ajax")
public class AjaxController {
    //第一种方式，服务器要返回一个字符串，直接使用response
    @RequestMapping("/a1")
    public void ajax1(String name, HttpServletResponse response){
        try{
            if("admin".equals(name)){
                response.getWriter().print("true");
            }else{
                response.getWriter().print("false");
            }
        }catch (Exception e){
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
    @RequestMapping("/a2")
    @ResponseBody
    public List a2(){
        List<User> list = new ArrayList<User>();
        User user = new User();
        user.setName("Flower");
        user.setSex("male");
        list.add(user);
        return list;
    }
}

导入jquery.js文件

//方法1：导入本地文件
<script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.js"></script>	 
/*不要使用<script/>自闭合*/

//方法2：使用http资源
<script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.6.0.js"></script>

function a1(){
	$.ajax({
		type:"Post",	//.ajax默认为Get请求	可以通过type修改请求方式 更常用$.post
		url:"${pageContext.request.contextPath}/ajax/a1",
		data:{"name":$(txtName).val()},
		success(data){
		console.log(data);
		}
});

function a2(){
	var html="";

	$.ajax({
		url:"${pageContext.request.contextPath}/ajax/a2",
		success(data){
            var html = "";
            console.log(data);
            for(var i = 0; i< data.length; i++){
                html  += "<tr>"+
                "<td>"+data[i].name+"</td>"+
                "<td>"+data[i].sex+"</td>"+
                "</tr>";
            }
            $("#tableBody").html(html);
        }
    });
}

找不到jquery文件

错误表现

GET http://localhost:8080/ajax_war_exploded/statics/js/jquery-3.6.0.js net::ERR_ABORTED 404

<!--在springmvc-config.xmlspringmvc-config.xml添加 js没找到-->
<mvc:resources location="/statics/js/" mapping="/statics/js/**"></mvc:resources>

json数据获取失败

错误表现

@ResponseBody 转json数据失败 在pom.xml添加依赖-->
<dependency>
      <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson.core</groupId>
      <artifactId>jackson-databind</artifactId>
      <version>2.13.0</version>
</dependency>

/ajax/a2访问404

错误表现

<!--在springmvc-config.xmlspringmvc-config.xml添加--><mvc:annotation-driven></mvc:annotation-driven>

故障再现

移出maven后包缓存仍在项目中

maven->生命周期->clean

entry.title: 英语3
entry.content:
unit 1

汉译英

1.你认为一个人要做些什么才能成为一个幸福的人？(to be a happy person)

What do you think one can do to be a happy person?

2. 自从她去年离开上海去重新过她的乡村生活后，我的心里一直很失落。(a void finds its way into…)

Since she left Shanghai and resumed her country life last year, a void has found its way into my heart.

Since she left Shanghai and resumed her life in the country last year, a void has found its way into my heart.

3. 我甚至没想过他会中头奖。(cross one’s mind)

It didn't even cross my mind that he would win the first prize.

4. 我是在大城市长大的，激烈的竞争（rat race）对我不再新鲜了。(grow up)

I grew up in a big city, so the rat race is no longer new to me.

英译汉

1.Slowly, a dark void found its way into my heart and began to eat away at my happiness.

慢慢地，我心里产生了一种阴暗的空虚感，它开始吞噬我的幸福。

2. My father wasn’t too keen on the idea of being back in the rat race, but I assured him that this time it would be nothing like that.

我父亲对回到那种你争我夺的生活不怎么感兴趣，但我向他保证，这一次绝对会有所不同。

3. As fate would have it, my life would soon change again, and in a very big way.

像是命运的安排，我的生活很快又发生了变化，而且是巨大的变化

4. While my surroundings were different and strange, they were also exciting and fun.

我的环境不一样了，它既陌生，但同时又激动人心而有趣。

unit 3

汉译英

**1. 这事件可能产生的后果（consequence）应予以认真考虑。（reflect on/upon） **

The likely consequences of the incident need to be reflected on/upon.

2. 他差点解决了这个问题。（within an inch of...）

He was within an inch of solving the problem.

3. 假如你要把财产转让给他人，须使他成为合法产权人（legal owner）（transfer... to）

If you want to transfer your property to someone, you should first make him the legal owner of it.

4. 自从公司迁到这个地区以来，已有数十台电脑被盗，公司决定采取措施制止盗窃。（take action）>

More than ten computers have been stolen since the company moved to this area, so the company decided to take action to stop it.

英译汉

1. Michael is no run-of-the-mill kind of guy. He is always happy and always has something positive to say.

迈克尔决非等闲之辈，他总是那么乐观，总能看到事物积极的一面。

2. If an employee had a bad day, Michael would tell him/her how to look on the positive side of the situation lest they’d continue feeling down.

假如某个员工哪一天遇到不顺心的事，迈克尔总是告诉他们如何看待事物积极的一面，以免他们继续感到沮丧

**3. Each time something bad happens, I can choose to be a victim or choose to see it as a type of learning. **

每当不幸降临时，我可以甘当受害者，也可以把它当作一种学习。

**4. I simply yelled: “I’m choosing to live. Work on me as if I am alive, not headed to the grave.” **

我索性吼道：“我要活下去！快救我，把我当活人医治，别把我当成快要死的人！”

unit 5

汉译英

1. 生活并不总是像美丽的童话，你得承认这点。（live with）

Life is not always like a fairy tale, and you have to live with it

2. 他们是德国最精明能干的（smartest）年轻人，是他们这一代人的精华。（the cream of the crop）

They were the smartest young people in Germany—the cream of the crop of their generation.

3. 这件事已经够复杂的（complex），你最好不要再插手了。（step in）

The thing has already been very complex, so you had better not step in again.

4. 多亏你的建议，没用多长时间就解决了困难。（iron out）

Thanks to your suggestion, it didn’t take long iron out the difficulties.

英译汉

1. People believe a suitable name can serve as an outline for a child’s future, elping to determine if the child will be a famous ainter or a piano player, a lawyer or a landlord.

人们相信一个合适的名字能够大致勾勒出一个孩子的前程，有助于确定这个孩子将来是一位有名的画家还是出色的钢琴家，是一位律师还是个旅馆老板。

2. Allthe boys in one generation of a family, the brothers and male cousins, will have the same first part to their name.

同一个家族的同一代人中的所有男孩，无论是亲兄弟还是堂兄弟，他们的名字的第一部分将是相同的。

3. Finally, some people name their children after famous rulers or public figures, like George Washington Carver, for example, or even after their favorite soap opera actors on television.

最后，一些人以有名的统治者或社会名人的名字来作为孩子的名字，比如像乔治华盛顿卡弗这样的名字，还有人以他们最喜欢的电视肥皂剧的演员的名字来给孩子取名。

4. This is also an issue in Japan, where the government feels children should not be given names that other children will make fun of.

命名在日本也是一个问题，日本政府认为人们应该避免给孩子们取一些会被其他孩子取笑的名字。

汉译英题目

1.你认为一个人要做些什么才能成为一个幸福的人？(to be a happy person)

2. 自从她去年离开上海去重新过她的乡村生活后，我的心里一直很失落。(a void finds its way into…)

3. 我甚至没想过他会中头奖。(cross one’s mind)

4. 我是在大城市长大的，激烈的竞争（rat race）对我不再新鲜了。(grow up)

**1. 这事件可能产生的后果（consequence）应予以认真考虑。（reflect on/upon） **

2. 他差点解决了这个问题。（within an inch of...）

3. 假如你要把财产转让给他人，须使他成为合法产权人（legal owner）（transfer... to）

4. 自从公司迁到这个地区以来，已有数十台电脑被盗，公司决定采取措施制止盗窃。（take action）

1. 生活并不总是像美丽的童话，你得承认这点。（live with）

2. 他们是德国最精明能干的（smartest）年轻人，是他们这一代人的精华。（the cream of the crop）

3. 这件事已经够复杂的（complex），你最好不要再插手了。（step in）

4. 多亏你的建议，没用多长时间就解决了困难。（iron out）

entry.title: 学生管理系统 C语言
entry.content:
/***********************************************************
学生管理系统
/
/
2020.6.16 制作菜单
制作动画
定义功能函数
初始化学生信息（名字 成绩 性别 学号）
/
/
2020.6.17 改使用#define MAXIZE 65535
制作修改功能
制作插入信息
制作删除信息
制作日志功能
/
/
2020.6.18 修改 修改 插入 删除 三种功能所使用的参数
/
/
2020.6.19 修正了名字输入超过3个字符不会提示错误信息的bug
修正了性别输入超过一个字符会死循环的bug
修正了成绩等级输入超过一个字符会死循环的bug
修正了对于输入成绩时输入非数字会产生死循环的bug
增加对于修改和删除时的核实信息
/
/
2020.6.20 制作按成绩排序功能(选择排序)
制作查找学生信息功能(遍历查找)
/
/
2020.6.21 增加快速排序
增加冒泡排序
增加的按表按信息顺序查找查找
将选择 快速 冒泡排序进行封装
制作查找学生成绩功能(遍历查找)
制作统计女生及格人数功能
制作统计男生平均成绩功能
修改了输出查找信息的格式
修正了在修改信息时修改性别时打回车无法进入下一
项的bug
修正了在修改信息时修改成绩等级时打回车无法进入
下一项的bug
修正了修改功能输入学号-1时无法进入下一项的bug
修正了插入功能中学号可以输入0的bug
/
/
2020.6.22 添加按五级制输出
所有基本功能已全部制作完成。
/
/
2020.6.23 修复了快速排序会死循环bug
修正查找成绩等级找不到的bug
修正了表是空时修改学生信息死循环的bug
/
/
账号：123
密码：456
***********************************************************/

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <windows.h>
#include <conio.h>
#include <time.h>

#define MAXSIZE 65535
#define CLOCKS_PER_SEC ((clock_t)(1000))
#define CLK_TCK CLOCKS_PER_SEC
int max;
clock_t start, end;

typedef struct
{
char name[10];
char sex;
int id;
int score;
char grade;
}student;

typedef enum {False,True} Bool;

student stu[MAXSIZE];
void Interface(); //生成界面
Bool Login(); //登录
void SystemTime(); //写入系统时间
void WriteWord(int index); //写入使用记录
void Printlist(); //输出顺序表 测试使用
Bool Checkid(int id); //检查学号是否使用
void QuickSorting(int start,int end,int index); //快速排序
int Partion(int low,int high,int index);
void SelectSort(int index); //选择排序
void BubbleSorting(int index); //冒泡排序

void Initialize(int max); //初始化成绩
student Modify(int place); //修改信息
student Insert(int place); //插入信息
student Del(int place); //删除信息
Bool ScoreRank(); //按成绩排序
void MAverage(); //男生平均成绩
int CountFPass(); //女生及格人数
void FindStu(); //查找学生信息
void FindScore(); //查找成绩信息
void FiveLevel(); //按五级制输出

char words[11][20]={""," use Initialize"," use Modify"," use Insert","use Del"," use ScoreRank"," use MAverage"," use CountFPass"," use FindStu"," use FindScore"," use FiveLevel"};

int main()
{
int i;
Bool b;
system("color A");
for(i=0;i<3;i++)
{
printf("还有%d次机会\n",3-i);
b=Login();
if(bTrue)
{
printf("\n密码正确\n");
printf("加载中：");
for(i=0;i<10;i++)
{
printf("##");
Sleep(100);
} //加载动画没有什么软用
printf("\n");
Interface();
break;
}
else
printf("密码错误\n");
}
if(i3)
{
printf("机会用尽:(\n");
exit(0);
}
do
{
do
{
printf("请选择功能:");
scanf("%d",&i);
}while(i<0 || i>11);
switch(i)
{
case 0:return 0;
case 1:{
printf("请输入初始化人数:");
scanf("%d",&max);
while(max<0 || max>MAXSIZE-2)
{
printf("请输入1-65533中的一个数\n");
scanf("%d",&max);
}
Initialize(max+1);
}
break;
case 2:{
student istu;
int place;
if(max>0)
{
printf("请输入你要修改第几条学生的信息:");
scanf("%d",&place);
while(place>max || place<1)
{
printf("输入的数字有误请输入1-%d的数",max);
scanf("%d",&place);
}
istu=Modify(place); //修改前的数据返回给istu，之后使用istu并尝试用栈实现回滚功能
}
else
{
printf("表是空的\n");
}
// printf("%s %c %c %d\n",istu.name,istu.sex,istu.grade,istu.score); //测试使用
}
break;
case 3:{
student istu;
int place;
if(max<MAXSIZE-2)
{
printf("请输入你要插入在第几条学生信息的位置:");
scanf("%d",&place);
while(place>max+1 || place<1)
{
printf("输入的数字有误请输入1-%d的数",max+1);
scanf("%d",&place);
}
istu=Insert(place);
max++;
}
else
{
printf("表已满\n");
}
}
break;
case 4:{
student istu;
int place;
if(max>0)
{
printf("请输入你要删除第几条学生信息的位置");
scanf("%d",&place);
while(place>max || place<1)
{
printf("输入的数字有误请输入1-%d的数",max);
scanf("%d",&place);
}
istu=Del(place);
max--;
}
else
printf("表已空\n");
}
break;
case 5:{
if(ScoreRank() == True)
printf("排序完成\n");
}
break;
case 6:MAverage(); break;
case 7:printf("女生及格人数为:%d\n",CountFPass()); break;
case 8:FindStu(); break;
case 9:FindScore(); break;
case 10:FiveLevel(); break;
case 11:Printlist(); break;
}
}while(i != 0);
}
void Interface()
{
printf("\t 学生成绩管理系统 \n");
printf("\t************************************\n");
printf("\t* 1: 初始化成绩 \n");
printf("\t 2: 修改信息 \n");
printf("\t 3: 插入信息 \n");
printf("\t 4: 删除信息 \n");
printf("\t 5: 按成绩排序 \n");
printf("\t 6: 男生平均成绩 \n");
printf("\t 7: 统计女生及格人数 \n");
printf("\t 8: 查找学生信息 \n");
printf("\t 9: 查找成绩信息 \n");
printf("\t 10: 按五级制输出 \n");
printf("\t 11: 顺序表输出 \n");//测试程序使用如要使用请将代码相对应部分的注释启用
printf("\t 0: 退出系统 \n");
printf("\t***********************************\n");
}
Bool Login()
{
char user[10];
char tuser[10]="123";
char password[10];
char tpassword[10]="456";
char c;
int i=0;
printf("请输入用户和密码\n");
printf("账号:");
gets(user);
printf("密码:");
while (1)
{
c=getch();
if(c=='\n' || c=='\r')
{
password[i]='\0';
break;
}
else
{
putchar('');
password[i++]=c;
}
}
if(strcmp(user,tuser)==0 && strcmp(password,tpassword)==0 )
return True;
return False;
}
void Initialize(int max)
{
long i;
char name[26]={'a','b','c','d','e','f','g','h','i','j','k','l','m','n','o','p','q','r','s','t','u','v','w','x','y','z'};
char sex[2]={'M','W'};
printf("初始化中，请稍后\n");
for(i=1;i<max;i++)
{
stu[i].score=rand()%101;
stu[i].name[0]=name[rand()%26];
stu[i].name[1]=name[rand()%26];
stu[i].name[2]=name[rand()%26];
stu[i].sex=sex[rand()%2];
stu[i].id=i;
}
printf("加载中：");
for(i=0;i<20;i++)
{
printf("#");
Sleep(100);
} //加载动画没有什么软用
printf("\n");
printf("初始化成功\n");
SystemTime();
WriteWord(1);
}
student Modify(int place)
{
char name[10],sex[10],grade[10];
int score,id,i;
student res;
res=stu[place];
getchar();
printf("如果该项无需修改请回车,如不想修改成绩和学号请到该项时输入-1\n");
printf("请输入修改后的名字的:");
gets(name);
while(strlen(name)>3)
{
printf("输入名字在三个字母以内\n");
gets(name);
}
for(i=0;i<strlen(name);i++)
{
stu[place].name[i]=name[i];
}
printf("请输入修改后的性别:");
gets(sex);
while(sex[0] != 'M' && sex[0] != 'W' || strlen(sex) >1)
{
printf("请输入修改后的性别M或W:");
gets(sex);
if(strlen(sex)==0)
break;
}
if(strlen(sex)==1)
stu[place].sex=sex[0];
printf("请输入修改后的成绩等级:");
gets(grade);
while(strlen(grade) !=1 || grade[0]<'A' || grade[0]>'E')
{
printf("请输入修改后的成绩等级A-E:");
gets(grade);
if(strlen(grade)0)
break;
}
if(strlen(grade) == 1)
stu[place].grade=grade[0];
do
{
printf("请输入成绩1-100:");
if (scanf("%d", &score) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
} while (score < -1 || score > 100);
if(score>-1)
stu[place].score=score;
do
{
printf("请你输入修改后的学号1-6553中的一个数,且与其他的学号不相同\n");
scanf("%d",&id);
if(id == -1)
break;
}while(place>6553 || place0 || Checkid(id)==False || id == 0);
if(id != -1)
stu[place].id=id;
printf("修改前的信息为: %s %c %c %d %d\n",res.name,res.sex,res.grade,res.score,res.id);
printf("修改后的信息为: %s %c %c %d %d\n",stu[place].name,stu[place].sex,stu[place].grade,stu[place].score,stu[place].id);
printf("修改完成\n");
SystemTime();
WriteWord(2);
return res;
}
student Insert(int place)
{
char name[10],sex[10],grade[10];
int i,id,score;
for(i=max+1;i>place;i--)
{
stu[i]=stu[i-1];
}
getchar();
printf("请输入学生姓名:");
gets(name);
while(strlen(name)>3 || !name[0])
{
printf("输入名字在三个字母以内且不为空\n");
gets(name);
}
for(i=0;i<strlen(name);i++)
{
stu[place].name[i]=name[i];
}
printf("请输入学生性别:");
gets(sex);
while(sex[0] != 'M' && sex[0] != 'W' || strlen(sex) != 1)
{
printf("请输入性别M或W:");
gets(sex);
}
stu[place].sex=sex[0];
printf("请输入成绩等级:");
gets(grade);
while(strlen(grade) !=1 || grade[0]<'A' || grade[0]>'E')
{
printf("请输入成绩等级A-E:");
gets(grade);
}
stu[place].grade=grade[0];
do
{
printf("请输入成绩1-100:");
if (scanf("%d", &score) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
} while (score < 0 || score > 100);
stu[place].score=score;
do
{
printf("请你输入学号1-6553中的一个数,且与其他的学号不相同\n");
scanf("%d",&id);
}while(place>6553 || place ==0 || Checkid(id)==False || id <= 0);
stu[place].id=id;
printf("添加的信息为: %s %c %c %d %d\n",stu[place].name,stu[place].sex,stu[place].grade,stu[place].score,stu[place].id);
printf("添加完成\n");
SystemTime();
WriteWord(3);
return stu[place];
}
student Del(int place)
{
student st;
int i;
st=stu[place];
for(i=place;i<max;i++)
{
stu[i]=stu[i+1];
}
printf("该信息 %s %c %c %d %d 已删除\n",st.name,st.sex,st.grade,st.score,st.id);
printf("删除成功\n");
SystemTime();
WriteWord(4);
return st;
}
Bool ScoreRank()
{
int index,select;
printf("\t***********************************\n");
printf("\t* 1: 选择排序 \n");
printf("\t 2: 快速排序 \n");
printf("\t 3: 冒泡排序 \n");
printf("\t***********************************\n");
do
{
printf("请选择排序方式:");
if (scanf("%d",&select) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
}while(select !=1 && select != 2 && select != 3);
do
{
printf("升序 1 降序 0 😊;
if (scanf("%d",&index) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
}while(index != 0 && index != 1);
if(select == 1)
{
SelectSort(index);
}
else if(select == 2)
{
QuickSorting(1,max,index);
}
else if(select == 3)
{
BubbleSorting(index);
}
return True;
}
void FindStu()
{
int select,i,score,id;
char sex[10],grade[10],name[10];
printf("\t************************************\n");
printf("\t* 1: 按名字查找 \n");
printf("\t 2: 按性别查找 \n");
printf("\t 3: 按成绩查找 \n");
printf("\t 4: 按成绩等级查找 \n");
printf("\t 5: 按学号查找 \n");
printf("\t 6: 按信息顺序查找 \n");
printf("\t 0: 退出查找 \n");
printf("\t***********************************\n");
do
{
do
{
printf("请选择功能(0-6)😊;

        if (scanf("%d", &select) != 1)  
            fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);  
    } while (select < 0 || select > 6);  
    if(select == 1)  
    {  
        printf("请输入学生姓名:");  
        gets(name);  
        while(strlen(name)>3 || !name[0])  
        {  
            printf("输入名字在三个字母以内且不为空\n");  
            gets(name);   
        }  
        for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)  
        {  
            if(!strcmp(name,stu[i].name))  
            {  
                printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].score,stu[i].grade,stu[i].id);  
                break;  
            }  
        }  
    }  
    else if(select == 2)  
    {  
        Bool flag=False;  
        getchar();  
        printf("请输入性别M或W:");  
        gets(sex);  
        while(sex[0] != 'M' && sex[0] != 'W' || strlen(sex) != 1)  
        {  
            printf("请输入性别M或W:");  
            gets(sex);  
        }  
        for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)  
        {  
            if(stu[i].sex==sex[0])  
            {  
                flag=True;  
                printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].score,stu[i].grade,stu[i].id);  
            }  

        }  
        if(flag == False)  
            printf("没找到\n");  
    }  
    else if(select == 3)  
    {  
        Bool flag=False;  
        do  
        {  
            printf("请输入成绩0-100:");  
            if (scanf("%d", &score) != 1)  
                fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);  
        } while (score < 0 || score > 100);  
        for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)  
        {  
            if(score == stu[i].score)  
            {  
                flag =True;  
                printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].score,stu[i].grade,stu[i].id);  
            }  
        }  
        if(flag == False)  
            printf("没找到\n");  
    }  
    else if(select == 4)  
    {  
        Bool flag=False;  
        do  
        {  
            printf("请输入成绩等级A-E:");  
            gets(grade);  
        }while(strlen(grade) !=1 || grade[0]<'A' || grade[0]>'E');  
        for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)  
        {  
            if(stu[i].grade==grade[0])  
            {  
                flag=True;  
                printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].score,stu[i].grade,stu[i].id);  
            }  
        }  
        if(flag == False)  
            printf("没找到\n");  
    }  
    else if(select == 5)  
    {  
        Bool flag =False;  
        do  
        {  
            printf("请输入学号1-6553:");  
            if (scanf("%d", &id) != 1)  
                fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);  
        } while (id < 1 || id > 6553);  
        for(i=1; i<max+1; i++)  
        {  
            if(id == stu[i].id)  
            {  
                flag=True;  
                printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].score,stu[i].grade,stu[i].id);  
            }  
        }  
        if(flag == False)  
            printf("没找到\n");  
    }  
    else if(select == 6)  
    {  
        int listid;  
        do  
        {  
            printf("请输入要查找的第几条学生信息(1-%d):",max);  
            if (scanf("%d", &listid) != 1)  
                fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);  
        } while (listid < 1 || listid > max);  
        printf("已找到:学生名字:%s 性别:%c 成绩:%d 成绩等级:%c 学号:%d\n",stu[listid].name,stu[listid].sex,stu[listid].score,stu[listid].grade,stu[listid].id);  
    }  
}while( select != 0);

}
void FindScore()
{
int select,i,id;
char name[10];
printf("\t************************************\n");
printf("\t* 1: 按名字查找 \n");
printf("\t 2: 按学号查找 \n");
printf("\t 0: 退出查找 \n");
printf("\t***********************************\n");
do
{
do
{
printf("请选择功能(0-2)😊;
if (scanf("%d", &select) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
} while (select < 0 || select > 2);
if(select == 1)
{
printf("请输入学生姓名:");
gets(name);
while(strlen(name)>3 || !name[0])
{
printf("输入名字在三个字母以内且不为空\n");
gets(name);
}
Bool flag=False;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
if(!strcmp(name,stu[i].name))
{
flag=True;
printf("已找到:学生:%s 成绩:%d 学号: %d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].score,stu[i].id);
break;
}
}
if(flag == False)
printf("没找到\n");
}
else if(select == 2)
{
Bool flag =False;
do
{
printf("请输入学号1-6553:");
if (scanf("%d", &id) != 1)
fseek(stdin, 0, SEEK_END);
} while (id < 1 || id > 6553);
for(i=1; i<max+1; i++)
{
if(id == stu[i].id)
{
flag=True;
printf("已找到:学生:%s 成绩:%d 学号: %d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].score,stu[i].id);
break;
}
}
if(flag == False)
printf("没找到\n");
}
}while(select !=0);
}
int CountFPass()
{
int count=0, i;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
if(stu[i].sex=='W' && stu[i].score>=60)
{
count++;
}
}
return count;
}
void MAverage()
{
long sum=0;
int i,count=0;
double average;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
if(stu[i].sex=='M')
{
sum+=stu[i].score;
count++;
}
}
average=sum/count;
printf("男生平均分为:%.2lf\n",average);
}
void FiveLevel()
{
int i;
int count=0;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
if(stu[i].score<60)
stu[i].grade='E';
else if(stu[i].score<70)
stu[i].grade='D';
else if(stu[i].score<80)
stu[i].grade='C';
else if(stu[i].score<90)
stu[i].grade='B';
else if(stu[i].score<=100)
stu[i].grade='A';
count++;
if(count % 5 != 0)
printf("姓名:%s 成绩等级:%c ",stu[i].name,stu[i].grade);
else
printf("姓名:%s 成绩等级:%c\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].grade);
}
}
void SystemTime() //我不会写这个功能，就这样吧，百度上的方法好长，天色已晚就不研究了:)
{
FILE *file;
time_t t;
t=time(NULL);
file = fopen("log.txt","a+");
fputc(t,file);
fclose(file);
}
void WriteWord(int index)
{
int i=0;
FILE *file;
file = fopen("log.txt","a+"); //建立日志文本
while(words[index][i])
{
fputc(words[index][i],file);
i++;
}
fclose(file);
}
Bool Checkid(int id)
{
int i;
Bool b=True;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
if(stu[i].id == id)
{
b=False;
break;
}
}
return b;
}
void Printlist()
{
int i;
student temp;
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
printf("%s %c %c %d\n",stu[i].name,stu[i].sex,stu[i].grade,stu[i].score);
} //测试使用

void SelectSort(int index)
{
int i,j;
student temp;
if(index==1)
{
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
index=i;
for(j=i+1;j<max+1;j++)
{
if(stu[index].score>stu[j].score)
{
index=j;
}
}
if(index !=i)
{
temp=stu[index];
stu[index]=stu[i];
stu[i]=temp;
}
}
}
else if(index == 0)
{
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
index=i;
for(j=i+1;j<max+1;j++)
{
if(stu[index].score<stu[j].score)
{
index=j;
}
}
if(index !=i)
{
temp=stu[index];
stu[index]=stu[i];
stu[i]=temp;
}
}
}
}

int Partion(int low,int high,int index) {
student temp;
temp=stu[low];
if(index == 1){
while (low < high) {
while (low < high && stu[high].score >= temp.score) {
high--;
}
stu[low] = stu[high];
while (low < high && stu[low].score <= temp.score) {
low++;
}
stu[high] = stu[low];

        }  
        stu[low] = temp;  
        return low;  
    }  
    else if(index == 0){  
        while (low < high) {  
            while (low < high && stu[high].score <= temp.score) {  
                high--;  
            }  
            stu[low] = stu[high];  
            while (low < high && stu[low].score >= temp.score) {  
                low++;  
            }  
            stu[high] = stu[low];  

        }  
        stu[low] = temp;  
        return low;  
    }

}
void QuickSorting(int start,int end,int index)
{
if(start<end)
{
int par=Partion(start,end,index);
QuickSorting(start,par-1,index);
QuickSorting(par+1,end,index);
}
}
void BubbleSorting(int index)
{
int i,j;
student temp;
if(index==1)
{
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
for(j=1;j<max+1-i;j++)
{
if(stu[j].score>stu[j+1].score)
{
temp=stu[j+1];
stu[j+1]=stu[j];
stu[j]=temp;
}
}
}
}
else if(index == 0)
{
for(i=1;i<max+1;i++)
{
for(j=1;j<max+1-i;j++)
{
if(stu[j].score<stu[j+1].score)
{
temp=stu[j+1];
stu[j+1]=stu[j];
stu[j]=temp;
}
}
}
}
}

entry.title: 读
entry.content:
An app is a "software application" developed for use on

mobile devices such as smart phones and tablet computers.Apps have become an integral part of our life. Most of usprobably can hardly imagine living without the apps. After all,it is really convenient to have a device that can e-mail, text,chat, video, order food, watch TV, bank online, and the listgoes on and on. However, when discussing these apps thathave brought what used to be "computer based" technologyto the palm of our hands, people argue a lot. It is easier, nowmore than ever, for us to be distracted. A recent study

indicated that the average owner of a smart phone checkstheir their devices 87 times dailv remember to use them wisely

entry.title: 英文
entry.content:
Americans believe no one stands still. If you are not moving ahead, you are falling behind. This attitude results in a nation of people committed to researching, experimenting and exploring. Time is one of the two elements that Americans save carefully, the other being labor.
“We are slaves to nothing but the clock,” it has been said. Time is treated as if it were something almost real. We budget it, save it, waste it, steal it, kill it, cut it, account for it; we also charge for it. It is a precious resource. Many people have a rather acute sense of the shortness of each lifetime. Once the sands have run out of a person’s hourglass, they cannot be replaced. We want every minute to count.

Many new arrivals in the States will miss the opening exchanges of business call, for example. They will miss the ritual interaction that goes with a welcoming cup of tea or coffee that may be a convention in their own country. They may miss leisurely business chats in a restaurant or coffee house. Normally, Americans do not assess their visitors in such relaxed surroundings over extended small talk; much less do they take them out for dinner, or around on the golf course while they develop a sense of trust. Since we generally assess and probe professionally rather than socially, we start talking business very quickly. Time is, therefore, always ticking in our inner ear.

Some new arrivals will come from cultures where it is considered impolite to work too quickly. Unless a certain amount of time is allowed to elapse, it seems in their eyes as if the task being considered were insignificant, not worthy of proper respect. Assignments are, consequently, given added weight by the passage of time. In the US, however, it is taken as a sign of skillfulness or being competent to solve a problem, or fulfill a job successfully, with speed. Usually, the more important a task is, the more capital, energy, and attention will be poured into it in order to “get it moving”.

Gail and I imagined a quiet wedding. During our two years together we had experienced the usual ups and downs of a couple learning to know, understand, and respect each other. But through it all we had honestly confronted the weaknesses and strengths of each other’s characters.
Our racial and cultural differences enhanced our relationship and taught us a great deal about tolerance, compromise, and being open with each other. Gail sometimes wondered why I and other blacks were so involved with the racial issue, and I was surprised that she seemed to forget the subtler forms of racial hatred in American society.

Gail and I had no illusions about what the future held for us as a married, mixed couple in America. The continual source of our strength was our mutual trust and respect.
We wanted to avoid the mistake made by many couples of marrying for the wrong reasons, and only finding out ten, twenty, or thirty years later that they were incompatible, that they hardly took the time to know each other, that they overlooked serious personality conflicts in the expectation that marriage was an automatic way to make everything work out right.
That point was emphasized by the fact that Gail’s parents, after thirty-five years of marriage, were going through a bitter and painful divorce, which had destroyed Gail and for a time had a negative effect on our budding relationship.

Soon after he volunteered for military service, he had received a book from this woman. A letter, which wished him courage and safety, came with the book. He discovered that many of his friends, also in the army, had received the identical book from the woman, Hollis Meynell. And while they all got strength from it, and appreciated her support of their cause, John Blandford was the only person to write Ms. Meynell back. On the day of his departure, to a destination overseas where he would fight in the war, he received her reply. Aboard the cargo ship that was taking him into enemy territory, he stood on the deck and read her letter to him again and again.

But when he asked her for a photo, she declined his request. She explained her objection: “If your feelings for me have any reality, any honest basis, what I look like won’t matter. Suppose I’m beautiful. I’d always be bothered by the feeling that you loved me for my beauty, and that kind of love would disgust me. Suppose I’m plain. Then I’d always fear you were writing to me only because you were lonely and had no one else. Either way, I would forbid myself from loving you. When you come to New York and you see me, then you can make your decision. Remember, both of us are free to stop or to go on after that—if that’s what we choose ...”

The girl in the green suit was walking quickly away and soon vanished into the fog. Blandford felt as though his heart was being compressed into a small cement ball, so strong was his desire to follow the girl, yet so deep was his longing for the woman whose spirit had truly companioned and brought warmth to his own; and there she stood. Her pale, fat face was gentle and intelligent; he could see that now. Her gray eyes had a warm, kindly look.
Blandford resisted the urge to follow the younger woman, though it was not easy to do so. His fingers held the book she had sent to him before he went off to the war, which was to identify him to Hollis Meynell.

Naturally, the name change didn’t cause Debbie / Lynne’s professional achievement—but it surely helped if only by adding a bit of self-confidence to her talents. Social scientists say that what you’re called can affect your life. Throughout history, names have not merely identified people but also described them. “… As his name is, so is he…”says the Bible, and Webster’s Dictionary includes the following definition of name: “a word or words expressing some quality considered characteristic or descriptive of a person or a thing, often expressing approval or disapproval”. Note well “approval or disapproval”. For better or worse, qualities such as friendliness or reserve, plainness or charm may be suggested by your name and conveyed to other people before they even meet you.

Names become attached to specific images, as anyone who’s been called “a plain Jane” or “just an average Joe” can show. The latter name particularly bothers me since my name is Joe, which some think makes me more qualified to be a baseball player than, say, an art critic. Yet, despite this disadvantage, I did manage to become an art critic for a time. Even so, one prominent magazine consistently refused to print “Joe” in my by-line, using my first initials, J.S., instead. I suspect that if I were a more refined Arthur or Adrian, the name would have appeared complete.
Of course, names with a positive sense can work for you, even encourage new acquaintances. A recent survey showed that American men thought Susan to be the most attractive female name, while women believed Richard and David were the most attractive for men.

entry.title: Hello Gridea
entry.summary:
👏 欢迎使用 Gridea ！
✍️ Gridea 一个静态博客写作客户端。你可以用它来记录你的生活、心情、知识、笔记、创意... ...
entry.content:
👏 欢迎使用 Gridea ！
✍️ Gridea 一个静态博客写作客户端。你可以用它来记录你的生活、心情、知识、笔记、创意... ...

Github
Gridea 主页
示例网站

特性👇

📝 你可以使用最酷的 Markdown 语法，进行快速创作

🌉 你可以给文章配上精美的封面图和在文章任意位置插入图片

🏷️ 你可以对文章进行标签分组

📋 你可以自定义菜单，甚至可以创建外部链接菜单

💻 你可以在 Windows，MacOS 或 Linux 设备上使用此客户端

🌎 你可以使用 𝖦𝗂𝗍𝗁𝗎𝖻 𝖯𝖺𝗀𝖾𝗌 或 Coding Pages 向世界展示，未来将支持更多平台

💬 你可以进行简单的配置，接入 Gitalk 或 DisqusJS 评论系统

🇬🇧 你可以使用中文简体或英语

🌁 你可以任意使用应用内默认主题或任意第三方主题，强大的主题自定义能力

🖥 你可以自定义源文件夹，利用 OneDrive、百度网盘、iCloud、Dropbox 等进行多设备同步

🌱 当然 Gridea 还很年轻，有很多不足，但请相信，它会不停向前 🏃

未来，它一定会成为你离不开的伙伴

尽情发挥你的才华吧！

😘 Enjoy~
